name: mira
text: This strip taught me how a laser printer works, and Beef makes me laugh in the 11th panel.

name: luckypyjamas
text: panels 4 and 9 are truly great. truly

name: deimosrising
text: It is pronounced "Hi - Mae"

name: panthera3000
text: Actually it's more like "Hi-Meh" but it doesn't really matter we still understand you guys

name: thommy_h
text: Roast Beef's sass about schools is legendary. His hidden contempt for Ray's ignorance is always great when it surfaces.

name: catachresis
text: Totally. That line is primo Achewood sass.

name: peterjoel
text:
One would hope the rarity of Beef's said ability decreases with proximity to a school. Unfortunately, the rarity/proximity relationship is not the prevalent case.

Could I have said that with fewer double negations? Probably. But I'm hell of hungover, so fuck you for asking.

name: saint
text: admitting you have a problem is the first step.

name: theryuujin
text: Nonsense!

name: cameasiam
text: Do you think it is rad to have alcoholism?

name: cathaoir
text: I don't know about you, but I certainly do.

name: tekende
text: A couple of my uncles do.

name: slab64
text: Go ahead and skip a day. Don't want you going into stage one renal failure.

name: aelindil
text: Or diabetes!

name: c_dizzle
text: I always teach my chemistry classes using metaphors. Works wonders.

name: foetus_punch
text: Indeed. I always teach the dumber students in my biology class using metaphors so that they don't beat me up. Also, my age. An Internet Lie.

name: rowboat
text: Wow. You're not very good at internet lying, apparently.

name: foetus_punch
text: I realized that it is completely a piece of shit thing to pretend to be an adult. If people find my opinions valid, I trust them to be mature enough to judge me on them rather than how I old I am.

name: wehavemagnums
text: I'd completely forgotten about Jaime the Science Friend.

name: mastronaut
text: I had too, but this is right after Cartilage Head and I was still a little shell shocked.

name: petitegitan
text: I love this strip so much.  Ray is reluctant, but ready to admit that he doesn't understand the fancy science talk.  And Beef is there for him with a simple answer.  Ah, friendship.

name: soticoto
text:
I once explained to my Ex-Wife exactly how and why people don't inbreed (the genetics of it) in terms of coloured cookies.

Seems Beef isn't the only one with a knack for explaining science to the science-impaired.
But wouldn't anyone who understood it find a way to explain to a friend who didn't?

name: sleepyhead
text: your ex wife left you for her cousin cause you metaphor was not so good?

name: soticoto
text:
No.
I set her up with another guy so she wouldn't be sad, and also so I wouldn't have to pay for the daughter I made with her.

name: lexsenthur
text: Man why is Ray trying to fix or figure out his printer in the dark? Did he shut off the power to the entire house to avoid the risk of electrocution because it's easier to walk up and trip a breaker than to crawl around and unplug the printer?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Because you can only see lasers in the dark.

Heh! Idiot.

name: trevor
text: This is probably my favorite story arch, and I am not sure why.

name: zefiel
text: Probably because you say 'arch' instead of 'arc'

name: halfdirt
text: KAPOW!

name: i_love_kate
text: That would have been one hell of a burn if it had made any sense.

name: howl
text: It's hard to find a way to point out other people's mistakes without looking like a douche

name: sargasm
text: Ha, I can see Ray shining a flashlight into his laser printer.  Probably looking for lasers.

name: nonentity
text: Ray has to turn the lights off to see the lazers. Step two for him would have been to blow smoke into it. Or, maybe, turn on a Pink Floyd album.

name: stuart
text: Wait. Socks stick to Ray? What the hell have I been doing wrong, that socks do not stick to me.

name: connellingus
text: You need more fur.

name: tttt2
text: in panel six Ray reminds Beef that he's stupid

name: jackparsons
text: Sciencia dammit.

name: dasilodavi
text:
Ray. The man who gets things done.

Seriously though. Textbook.

name: relaxing
text: Probably not

name: fosters
text: I like how hesitant beef is when answering the phone. He doesn't know who's on the other end, but he's sure it will be bad news.

name: rowboat
text: Damn. I missed this the first two times through, but Ray is "in the dark." In more ways than one. Genius. There are probably 1,000 such extreme subtleties which I've missed. I'll have to look more carefully on the third time around.

name: charchar
text: I used to watch Bill Nye, the Science Guy in Spanish. It's called Bill el Cientifico . I don't even speak Spanish.

name: milkpants
text: ray is in the dark when it comes to laser printers

name: zem
text: this comment owns!

name: zem
text: i guess rowboat made the same pun just before so to be fair i'm giving him a chubby too but i'm not going to enjoy it

name: littlefatdog
text: Another good example of " RAY SMUCKLES: HE GETS THINGS DONE! "

name: ham_shoes
text: Panel four: COMPLETE BLANKNESS

name: lordpretzel
text: I love that Ray holds power over the Gallup organization to "run a little poll." Dude has connections.

name: fattypneumonia
text:
Nobody cares, but I was just drivin' around today, and realized that I didn't know exactly how a laser printer worked (ain't no laser beams in there, FOOL!), and was going to read up on it online tonight. As always, the answers to all of life's questions can be found in Achewood.

Achewood: better than Google.

name: puguglypress
text: Probably not

name: terriblerobot
text:
I had this exact thing happen to me last week, and forgot to look it up. And here Achewood has explained it is textbook form, and entertained me all at once. Achewood: definitely better than Google.

Dude below, I wish I could explain just how wrong you are, but alas, I can't figure out how to incorporate a sock into it.
